description: Proposed Change of Use of Ground Floor - From Class E(c)(i) (formerly Class A2) to Dual Uses comprising: E(c)(i) Pawn Brokers and E(b) Bakery and proposed placement of 2 tables and 4 chairs at the front of bakery for the use of customers; installation of new weather louver at the rear of the property

phasing_details.phase_detail: installation of new weather louver at the rear of the property

decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans and on the submitted application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The E(c)(i) pawn broker use to which this permission relates shall not open outside of the following hours:Monday to Friday: 9:30am to 5:00pmSaturday: 09:30am to 12:30pmSunday & Bank Holiday: closedReason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The E(b) Bakery use to which this permission relates shall not open outside of the following hours:Monday to Friday: 08:00am to 6:00pmSaturday: 08:00am to 6:00pmSunday & Bank Holiday: 08:00am to 6:00pmReason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Notwithstanding Section 55 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) (or any Order revoking and reenacting that Order with or without modification), the premises shall only be used for the purposes specified in the application documents and for no other purposes whatsoever (including any other purposes falling within E(c)(i) Pawn Brokers and E(b) Bakery of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (or any provision equivalent to that class in any Order revoking and reenacting that Order with or without modification).Reason: The acceptability of the development is highly dependent upon the exact nature of the use of the site and other uses, whether within the same use class or permitted by the General Permitted Development Order, are unlikely to be acceptable in planning terms.

Prior to the commencement of the E(b) bakery use a delivery and service plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved plan.Reason: To ensure proper delivery and service management in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policies T4 and T7 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS7 and DM9 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to the commencement of the E(b) bakery use, a  waste management plan (refuse and recycling) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved plan.Reason: To ensure proper delivery and service management in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policies T4 and T7 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS7 and DM9 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The external tables and chairs associated with the E(b) bakery use shall be removed from outside the front of the premises and stored safely and securely inside the premises outside of the permitted hours of use of the E(b) bakery hereby permitted.Reason: To ensure protection of the amenities of the area in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The rating level of the noise from the kitchen extract system hereby permitted shall be at least 5dBA lower than the existing background noise level at any given time of operation.  The noise levels shall be measured or predicted 1m externally to any window at the nearest residential facade.  Measurements and assessment shall be made according to British Standard 4142:2014.Reason: To ensure protection of the amenities of the area in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to commencement of the development the applicant shall provide a scheme to the Local Planning Authority for its written approval detailing sound transmission reduction measures to be installed between the ground floor use and the first floor flat.  The scheme shall be designed to provide at least Dntw +Ctr 55dB. Once agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority the approved details shall be installed prior to the development being occupied and retained thereafter.Reason: To ensure protection of the amenities of the area in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The site and building works required to implement the development shall be only carried out between the hours of 08.00 and 18.00 Mondays to Fridays and between 08.00 and 13.00 on Saturdays and not at all on Bank Holidays and Sundays.Reason: To ensure protection of the amenities of the area in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
The proposal includes demolition of a garage, therefore please submit existing plan and elevations of the garage to be demolished.

Householder Checklist Update - This Checklist forms part of the application submission and must be correct. Please ensure you have provided all documents required to support your application in line with the Householder Validation Local List and update the Householder Checklist document with any changes you have made to your application.

Proposal Description - This has been amended for clarity. Please confirm if you agree, or amend if you disagree with the following description: "Demolition of rear conservatory and dormer roof extension and erection of single storey rear extension and hip to gable and rear dormer roof extension to extend loft conversion. Changes to fenestrations."
We received two location plans with different red outline, please revise the location plan with correct red outline.
Please provide 'Biodiversity Checklist.' The Biodiversity Checklists can be obtained via the council's website:https://www.kingston.gov.uk/downloads/file/2738/biodiversity-checklist

The planning fee has been changed from 1st April 2025, since we received your application on 1st April 2012, the fee required for your planning application is Â£ 298.00.  we acknowledge the receipt of Â£ 293.00, please pay the outstanding balance of Â£5.00. Payment can be made online via the Kingston council website or our Contact Centre on 020 8547 5002.
The proposed site has TPO, therefore please submit tree report.
The site is in a conservation area, therefore please submit 'Heritage Statement'.
Please submit 'Biodiversity Metric Calculation Tool' in excel format.
